document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Coreodrassus (Araneae: Gnaphosidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Coreodrassus (Araneae: Gnaphosidae) from China

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 1 – 6. Coreodrassus lancearius (Simon, 1893). 1. Female body, dorsal view. 2. Epigyne, ventral view. 3. Vulva, dorsal view. 4. Left male palp, dorsal view, showing tibial and patellar apophyses. 5. Left male palp, ventral view. 6. Left male palp, retrolateral view. A = atrium; CO = copulatory opening; EC = epigynal cavity; FD = fertilization duct; S = spermathecae; SA = spermathecal apophysis. Scale bars: 1, 1 mm; 2 – 6, 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis: Male palp with a bifid retrolateral tibial apophysis, with the distal parts of upper branch and lower branch crossing each other; and a very long retrolateral patellar apophysis, hooked at the distal end. Epigynal plate with a pronounced atrium anteriorly, copulatory openings concealed at lateral margins of atrium, and a pair of broad epigynal cavities posteriorly. Spermathecae nearly ball-shaped, touching at midline, with a tubeshaped apophysis laterally.

Description: FEMALE (Xilin Gol League, Inner Mongolia measured). Total length 9.54 : cephalothorax 3.15 long, 2.34 wide; abdomen 5.94 long, 3.38 wide. Eye sizes and interdistances: AME 0.15 , ALE 0.13 , PME 0.16 , PLE 0.11 ; AME–AME 0.13 , AME–ALE 0.03 , PME–PME 0.05 , PME–PLE 0.14 , ALE–PLE 0.09 . MOA 0.38 long, front width 0.39 , back width 0.34 . Clypeus height 0.13 . Leg formula: 4123 .

MALE (Xiuning County, Anhui Province measured). Total length 7.94 : cephalothorax 3.31 long, 2.44 wide; abdomen 4.63 long, 2.58 wide. Eye sizes and interdistances: AME 0.13 , ALE 0.13 , PME 0.13 , PLE 0.14 ; AME–AME 0.13 , AME–ALE 0.02 , PME–PME 0.04 , PME–PLE 0.15 , ALE–PLE 0.09 . MOA 0.40 long, front width 0.32 , back width 0.29 . Clypeus height 0.13 . Leg formula: 4123 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–6.
Coreodrassus lancearius
(Simon, 1893). 1. Female body, dorsal view. 2. Epigyne, ventral view. 3. Vulva, dorsal view. 4. Left male palp, dorsal view, showing tibial and patellar apophyses. 5. Left male palp, ventral view. 6. Left male palp, retrolateral view. A = atrium; CO = copulatory opening; EC = epigynal cavity; FD = fertilization duct; S = spermathecae; SA = spermathecal apophysis. Scale bars: 1, 1 mm; 2–6, 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution: China (Hebei, Shanxi, Inner Mongolia , Anhui, Gansu); Kazakhstan , Korea , Japan .

Type material.
Drassodes lancearius
Simon, 1893
: the type specimens presumably deposited in the Natural History Museum of Paris, not examined.
Drassodes potanini
Schenkel, 1963
: female holotype from Stada Guidui of Inner Mongolia ( May 7, 1885 ), China , is deposited in the Natural History Museum of Basel, Switzerland , not examined.
Coreodrassus coreanus
Paik, 1984
: type specimens are deposited in the collection of the Kyungpook University, Taegu, Korea , not examined.

Material examined: One male from Xiuning County, Anhui Province, China , October 29, 1984 , Y. J. Xu leg. ( MHBU ). One female from Taigu County, Shanxi Province, China , May 1, 1984 , M. S. Zhu leg. ( MHBU ). One female from Guandi Mountain, Fangshan County, Shanxi Province, China , June 2, 1982 , M. S. Zhu leg. ( MHBU ). One female from Ming’antu Town, Zhengxiangbai Banner, Xilin Gol League, Inner Mongolia , China , May 1, 2005 , Y. C. Guo leg. ( MHBU ).
